author: Kentaro Tsutsumi
description: Activist investors are likely to find more opportunities in Japanese real estate as unrealized gains are poised to swell under new Liberal Democratic Party leader Sanae Takaichi.
title: Japan’s Political Shakeup Opens Door for Real Estate Activism

author: Sarah Holder, David Fox, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: Escalating international and economic pressure led to a new peace deal in Gaza. On today’s Big Take podcast: Can it last?
title: The International Pressure That Led to the Israel-Hamas Ceasefire

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Israel’s government approved a deal that will see Hamas release any remaining hostages held in Gaza in exchange for more than 2,000 prisoners, another major step toward fulfilling the terms of a peace agreement and ending the two sides’ bloody conflict.
title: Israel Government Approves Gaza Hostage Deal, PM’s Office Says

author: Miranda Davis, Madlin Mekelburg
description: A federal judge blocked President Donald Trump’s effort to send hundreds of National Guard troops to Chicago to counter protests against his immigration crackdown, the latest setback in the administration’s effort to deploy soldiers in Democratic-led cities.
title: Trump Troop Deployment to Chicago Blocked for Now by Judge

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The US military command responsible for the Middle East will play a role in Gaza’s transition once a peace deal is finalized, though American troops aren’t intended to be deployed on the ground in Gaza itself, US officials said Thursday.
title: US Military to Play Role in Gaza Transition, Officials Say

author: Nicola M White
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission offered some relief to would-be public companies stuck in regulatory limbo as the government shutdown drags on.
title: SEC Offers Relief for IPOs Stuck in Limbo During Shutdown

author: Ethan Bronner, Fadwa Hodali, Krishna Karra, Tom Fevrier, Dina Esfandiary
description: Most of the 2.2 million population has been internally displaced, and many no longer have homes to return to, even if the fragile Israel-Hamas ceasefire holds.
title: As Fragile Ceasefire Takes Hold, Gazans Ask ‘Who Will Be in Charge?’

author: Lucy White
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he can see no return to frontline politics for Peter Mandelson, a month after firing the Labour grandee as his US ambassador.
title: Starmer Sees No Future Role in UK Government for Peter Mandelson

author: Samy Adghirni, Francois de Beaupuy
description: The political power players aren’t the only ones jockeying to shape the shifting balance of power in a turbulent France.
title: France’s Power Brokers Jockey as Macron Tries to Forge Coalition

author: Myles Miller, Chris Strohm
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James was indicted by a grand jury in Virginia, according to people familiar with the matter, following calls from President Donald Trump for her prosecution.
title: NY Attorney General Letitia James Indicted Over Fraud Claims

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: The top allies of unpopular President Dina Boluarte are turning on her as they suddenly show support to impeach and oust her, over widespread criticism of her handling of rising crime.
title: Allies of Peru’s Boluarte Turn on Her to Back Impeachment

author: Nathan Risser
description: Sable Offshore Corp. is seeking the Trump administration’s help to jumpstart a California oil project that’s awaiting regulatory approval.
title: Texas Oil Driller Taps Trump’s Team to Save California Crude Project

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren asked a group representing hedge funds and other asset managers to describe what role, if any, it played in the Trump administration’s deliberations over how to extend US financial support to Argentina during a period of market turmoil.
title: Warren Asks Hedge Fund Group If It Played Argentina Bailout Role

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at Trump’s diplomatic victory in getting a ceasefire in Gaza. Sign up here and email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Drive to Broker a Gaza Ceasefire Pays Off

author: Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump floated the idea that Spain could be removed from the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in his latest swipe against a chronic under-spender on defense.
title: Trump Suggests Tossing Spain Out of NATO as a Bottom Spender

author: Myles Miller
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem told President Donald Trump that she wants to buy more buildings in Chicago for immigration agents to operate from as the administration seeks to carry out its promise of mass deportations.
title: ICE Wants to Buy More Buildings in Chicago as Crackdown Expands

author: Reshmi Basu
description: Federal prosecutors are looking into the circumstances around the spectacular collapse of auto-parts supplier First Brands Group, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Federal Prosecutors Are Looking Into First Brands Collapse

author: Bailey Lipschultz
description: From a data center startup with one customer to special purpose acquisition companies helping form hoarders of speculative crypto tokens, firms raising hundreds of millions of dollars in the equity market are increasingly touting their links to President Donald Trump.
title: Firms Are Capitalizing on White House, Trump Ties to Go Public

author: Suzanne Lynch
description: Belgian authorities said they uncovered a terrorist plan to target Belgian politicians after a number of raids were carried out in Antwerp on Thursday.
title: Belgium Says It Stopped Terrorist Plot Aimed at Prime Minister

author: Lauren Rosenthal, Katy O'Donnell
description: A lapse in the National Flood Insurance Program because of the US government shutdown threatens to snarl home sales in the nation’s riskiest floodplains and leave some homeowners without coverage in the middle of hurricane season.
title: Shutdown Cuts Off Flood Insurance Program During Storm Season

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US judge has temporarily imposed stricter limits on when federal agents can use physical force and make arrests during Chicago-area demonstrations against the Trump administration’s ramped up immigration enforcement.
title: Federal Use of Force in Chicago Protests Is Restricted by Judge

author: William Horobin
description: France’s economic growth was resilient in recent months despite heightened political uncertainty weighing on business leaders, the country’s central bank said.
title: French Economy Is Weathering Political Crisis, Central Bank Says

author: Catherine Lucey, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump predicted China would resume purchases of American soybeans after meeting President Xi Jinping, though a cabinet official said federal relief for beleaguered farmers will have to wait until the government reopens.
title: Trump Predicts China Would Resume Buying US Soybeans

author: Andrea Palasciano, Max Ramsay
description: The US could deliver spare military capability to Ukraine to help the war-battered nation bolster its battlefield position against Russia and bring President Vladimir Putin to the negotiating table, a senior American diplomat said.
title: US May Send Spare Military Capability to Ukraine, Envoy Says

author: Anthony Halpin
description: An inaugural Russia-Arab summit due to be held next week is to be postponed as a deal based on US President Donald Trump’s proposal for Gaza begins to be implemented, according to the Kremlin.
title: Putin Postpones Russia-Arab Summit, Citing  Gaza Ceasefire Deal

author: Tom Rees
description: For months, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has been bracing for the UK’s fiscal watchdog to blow a hole in her plans.
title: Reeves May Get Budget Lifeline From New UK Productivity Data

author: Galit Altstein
description: Families and supporters of the remaining Israeli hostages held by Hamas flocked on Thursday to the Tel Aviv square that’s become the focal point of two years of campaigning for their release.
title: Hostage Supporters Flock to Tel Aviv to Celebrate End of Watch

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: A New Jersey businessman who conspired to bribe former US Senator Bob Menendez but then became a key government witness avoided a prison term in the corruption case.
title: NJ Businessman Who Bribed Menendez, Became Witness Avoids Prison

author: Kate O'Keeffe, Josh Sisco, Kate Sullivan
description: The Trump administration is considering whether to take a major step toward restricting the US operations of TP-Link Systems Inc., a China-linked router-maker whose Wi-Fi equipment is popular in the American market, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Weighs Action Against China-Linked Router Giant TP-Link

author: Ben Bartenstein
description: The US sanctioned more than 50 individuals, firms and vessels involved in exporting Iranian oil and liquefied petroleum gas, including a key crude-import terminal.
title: US Hits Firms Moving Iranian Oil and Major China Crude Terminal

author: Rakesh Sharma
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with US President Donald Trump to review progress in trade deal negotiations, indicating continued engagement towards finalizing a pact.
title: India’s Modi Reviews Trade Talk Progress in Call with Trump

author: Alexandra S Levine
description: YouTube users who were banned from the service for violating its policies related to issues like the 2020 election results or Covid-19 misinformation may soon be able to rejoin the platform.
title: YouTubers Banned Over Covid, Election Misinformation May Soon Return

author: Christina Kyriasoglou
description: The German government is scaling back financial aid for its semiconductor industry, cutting planned subsidies by €3 billion ($3.5 billion) over the next few years as it seeks to overhaul aging infrastructure.
title: Germany to Spend €3 Billion Earmarked for Chip Industry on Roads

author: Zoe Tillman
description: US judges have rejected the Justice Department’s requests to delay more than a dozen legal challenges to President Donald Trump’s policies as the government shutdown enters its second week.
title: Trump Court Battles Must Continue During Shutdown, Judges Rule

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent touted a drop in a key US fiscal ratio as evidence that President Donald Trump’s economic policies are working without causing a recession.
title: Bessent Touts Drop in Deficit-to-GDP Ratio, Sees Tax-Refund Wave

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations stands ready to support any humanitarian efforts in in Gaza following the announcement of a ceasefire and hostage deal with Israel, Secretary-General António Guterres told reporters on Thursday.
title: Guterres Says UN ‘Prepared to Move’ After Gaza Ceasefire Accord

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin acknowledged that a Russian air defense system was responsible for the crash of an Azerbaijan Airlines passenger jet that killed 38 people in December, a rare admission that could ease almost yearlong tensions with Baku.
title: Putin Admits Russian Missiles Caused Azeri Jet Crash in December

author: Caitlin Reilly, Maria Paula Mijares Torres
description: Republican and Democratic congressional leaders continued to blame one another for the US government shutdown, not budging from their stances and talking points as the impasse entered its ninth day.
title: Johnson, Jeffries Keep Fingers Pointed as US Shutdown Drags On

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s new ruling party chief Sanae Takaichi pushed back against the view she favors further weakness in the yen, a comment that follows a slump in the currency in the aftermath of her leadership win at the weekend.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Denies Intention to Spur Further Yen Weakness

author: Margi Murphy, Lauren Rosenthal, Zahra Hirji
description: Investigators are looking for staffers who anonymously endorsed an open letter criticizing the Trump administration’s cuts to disaster funding.
title: FEMA Tells Staff to Name Whistleblowers or Risk Losing Jobs

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: European Central Bank Governing Council member José Luis Escrivá warned that the current levels of uncertainty are unprecedented.
title: ECB’s Escrivá Warns of Unprecedented Level of Economic Uncertainty

author: William Horobin, Kamil Kowalcze, Jorge Valero
description: France’s caretaker finance minister, Roland Lescure, said the country is on course to meet its budget promises to the European Union, even after outgoing premier Sebastien Lecornu indicated there will be less fiscal consolidation next year than previously planned.
title: France Will Deliver on Pledge to Meet Deficit Goal, Lescure Says

author: Dasha Afanasieva
description: Dutch prosecutors have summoned a foreign pension fund over more than €200 million ($232 million) in suspected dividend tax evasion.
title: Dutch Prosecutor Summons Pension Fund Over Dividend Tax Evasion Suspicions

author: Erik Larson, Madlin Mekelburg
description: President Donald Trump’s plan to send hundreds of troops to Oregon and Illinois to counter protests against his immigration crackdown faces two major tests in court Thursday, as state officials continue to raise the alarm about the White House’s domestic use of the military.
title: Trump’s US Troop Plans Head to Court in Two High-Stakes Hearings

author: Erin Hudson
description: A controversial new law championed by President Donald Trump to funnel federal dollars into private schools is fueling a campaign to get Democratic governors to opt in to the first national school choice program in the US.
title: Trump’s School Choice Law Ignites Lobbying Push in Democratic States
House Minority Leader Jeffries Says No Recent Talks Between Parties on Shutdown

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is searching for a new prime minister capable of holding together a fragile accord among rival lawmakers to deliver an urgently needed budget.
title: Macron Searches for New Premier to Lead Likely Shift to the Left

author: Oliver Crook, Aaron Eglitis
description: Latvian Prime Minister Evika Silina said she welcomed the European Union’s plan to set up a so-called drone wall along the eastern border of the bloc, but called the idea “very raw.”
title: Latvian Prime Minister Says Drone Wall Idea is ‘Very Raw’

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway is bracing for the aftermath of the Nobel Peace Prize announcement on Friday as the Nordic nation has faced increasing pressure from Donald Trump and his administration to award it to the US leader.
title: Norway on Edge Over Trump Ahead of Nobel Peace Prize Verdict

author: Irina Anghel
description: Religious hate crime has surged in England and Wales over the past two years amid rising community tensions stoked by Hamas’s attack on Israel in October 2023 and the ensuing war in Gaza.
title: UK Police See Surge in Religious Hate Crimes Over Past Two Years

author: Godfrey Marawanyika
description: Zimbabwe pledged to crack down on illicit commodities trading and introduce rules to encourage downstream processing, as the nation seeks a greater share of the benefits from its natural resources.
title: Zimbabwe Pushes Mineral Processing as It Takes Aim at Corruption

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: The US and Finland will sign a deal to kickstart the expansion of the American icebreaker fleet due to the rising geopolitical importance of the Arctic.
title: US and Finland to Sign Icebreaker Deal as Trump Hosts Stubb

author: Max Ramsay
description: Two no-confidence motions in European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen fail to get sufficient support and are rejected in European Parliament.
title: Von Der Leyen No-Confidence Votes Fail in EU Parliament

author: Katia Dmitrieva, Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: Three central banks over two days surprised markets and economists with unexpected interest rate decisions, each flashing warning signs over growth in the coming months and stirring uncertainty over the path of policy.
title: Surprise Rate Decisions in Asia Signal Growing Economic Unease

author: Deena Shanker
description: Kevin Hall says the science behind the allure of ultraprocessed foods keeps evolving.
title: Five Questions for Ex-NIH Official Who Says RFK Jr. Tried to Censor Him

author: Paul Wallace
description: The agreement is a huge moment for Israelis, Palestinians and the wider Middle East.
title: A Gaza Hostage Deal to Calm the Middle East

author: Srinivasan Sivabalan
description: Israeli markets staged a broad rally, sending the shekel to a three-year high, after the country reached a hostage-release deal with Hamas that brings it closer to ending the war in Gaza.
title: Israel Markets Gain as Shekel Tops Three-Year High on Hamas Deal

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: President Donald Trump has picked a supporter who’s critical of China as his ambassador to the Philippines, a long-time US ally that’s central to American-led efforts to deter Beijing.
title: Trump Picks Pal Who Counters China Influence as Philippine Envoy

author: Allyson Versprille, Ted Mann
description: US air travel is beginning to show signs of strain as lawmakers remain at loggerheads over ending a government shutdown that has stretched into a second week with limited appetite in Congress for a quick resolution.
title: Air Travel Disruptions Add Pressure on Congress for Shutdown Deal

author: Oscar Medina, Matthew Bristow
description: When Colombians say that President Gustavo Petro made a “pact with the devil” to get elected, they are often thinking of his former campaign chief Armando Benedetti.
title: Colombia’s Top Fixer Flexes His ‘Magic Power’ as Elections Near

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Virginia gubernatorial candidates Abigail Spanberger and Winsome Earle-Sears will try to saddle one another with figures from their parties considered to be politically burdensome when they debate Thursday, in a race that perennially serves as an early bellwether for midterm elections.
title: Virginia Governor Hopefuls to Debate as Violent Texts Roil Race

author: Gresa Kraja, Misha Savic
description: Kosovo defended its purchase of Turkish-made kamikaze drones after Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic accused Ankara of violating international law, further straining relations between the two Balkan nations.
title: Serbian Leader Lashes Out at Turkey Over Drone Deal With Kosovo

author: Philip Glamann
description: China said the collapse of an espionage trial that had been brought by the UK’s chief prosecutor shows that the case was without merit all along — comments that come as the two nations take early steps to repair ties.
title: China Dismisses UK Spy Claims as Fabrication After Case Dropped

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber, Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling alliance agreed on new purchase incentives for zero-emission vehicles worth €3 billion ($3.5 billion) through 2029, part of his government’s broader effort to support the nation’s ailing carmakers.
title: German Coalition Agrees on EV Incentives Worth €3 Billion

author: Dan Williams, Fares Alghoul, Galit Altstein
description: Israel and Hamas have reached a deal for the release of all hostages held by the militant group in Gaza, a major step toward ending a two-year war that’s devastated the Palestinian territory and triggered multiple conflicts in the Middle East as well as protests across the world.
title: Israel, Hamas Reach Deal to Free Hostages in Gaza Breakthrough

author: Yihui Xie
description: Beijing is seizing the opportunity to offer up an alternative to US financial dominance.
title: Gold’s Record Rally Is Helping China Challenge Trump and the Dollar

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said a delegation of top Ukrainian officials will visit the US early next week to discuss Russian frozen assets, air defense and sanctions against Moscow as prospects for peace fade.
title: Top Ukraine Officials to Discuss Russian Assets in US Next Week

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: The Bank of Thailand will likely keep monetary policy loose through next year, according to a deputy governor, given the country’s weak economy and the risk of further global shocks.
title: Thailand to Keep Rate Accommodative Through 2026, Piti Says

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: German exports unexpectedly fell for a second month as the value of shipments to the US plunged to their lowest level in almost four years amid President Donald Trump’s tariff campaign.
title: German Exports Unexpectedly Drop as Shipments to the US Sink

author: Anna Irrera, Emily Nicolle, Lucy White
description: In late July, senior executives from some of the world’s largest digital-asset companies gathered in the City of London to hear Zia Yusuf, head of policy at the right-wing Reform UK party, lay out his vision for crypto’s role in Britain’s financial industry.
title: Crypto Helped Get Trump Elected. Now It’s Wooing UK’s Farage

author: Lucy White, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his British counterpart Keir Starmer began their bilateral meeting in Mumbai on Thursday, as the UK leader pushes for swift implementation of the free trade agreement the two nations signed earlier this year.
title: Starmer, Modi Meet in Mumbai to Deepen Trade, Business Ties

author: Katharine Gemmell, Alfred Cang
description: A price dispute between mining giant BHP Group and China’s state-run iron ore buyer risks dragging on for months, and even into early 2026, as both sides remain locked in stalemate.
title: BHP-China Iron Ore Standoff May Drag Into 2026 as Talks Stall

author: Anthony Halpin
description: When Vladimir Putin joins summits of former Soviet states in Tajikistan this week, the leaders around the table will most likely declare their close bonds with Russia. In reality, many have been distancing themselves from Moscow since the invasion of Ukraine.
title: Putin’s War in Ukraine Is Breaking Russia’s Hold Over Its Former Empire

author: Ewa Krukowska, Natalia Drozdiak, Daryna Krasnolutska, Alberto Nardelli
description: Russian strikes in recent days have wiped out more than half of Ukraine’s domestic natural gas production, likely forcing the war-battered country to spend 1.9 billion euros ($2.2 billion) on fuel imports to survive the looming winter.
title: Russian Strikes Knock Out More than Half of Ukraine Gas Production Ahead of Winter

author: Kelcee Griffis, Lucas Shaw
description: Comedian Jimmy Kimmel thought his late-night show was over after ABC suspended the program following comments he made over the assassination of political activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Kimmel Thought His Show Was Finished After ABC Suspension

author: Mackenzie Hawkins
description: The US has approved several billion dollars worth of Nvidia Corp. chip exports to the United Arab Emirates, an initial step in implementing a controversial deal that could serve as a blueprint for American AI statecraft.
title: US Approves Some Nvidia UAE Sales In Step of Trump AI Diplomacy

author: Josh Xiao
description: China announced it is tightening the export of rare earth technologies, broadening restrictions that have been a source of tension between Beijing and Washington.
title: China Tightens Exports of Rare Earths and Related Technology

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s new ruling party leader, Sanae Takaichi, has yet to reach an agreement with the party’s long-time coalition partner Komeito about continuing their alliance, a delay that highlights the challenges she faces in building a stable administration.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Faces Early Test as Coalition Talks Stall
